Sentencas: This paper presents a technical and economic analysis of a solid oxide fuel cell system equipped with a palladium membrane reactor (PMR-SOFC) with the aim of determining the benefits of such an integrated unit over the conventional reformer module (CON-SOFC).
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and palladium membrane reactor: Technical and economic analysis

Sentencas: The performance of both SOFC systems under the conditions for energetically self-sustaining operation (Q(NET) = 0) was achieved by varying the fuel utilization for each operating voltage.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and palladium membrane reactor: Technical and economic analysis

Sentencas: Two types of fuels, i.e., methane and desulphurized biogas, are considered.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and palladium membrane reactor: Technical and economic analysis

Sentencas: The simulation results show that the maximum power density of the CON-SOFC fuelled by methane (0.423 W/cm(2)) is higher than that of the CON-SOFC fuelled by biogas (0.399 W/cm(2)) due to the presence Of CO2 in biogas.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and palladium membrane reactor: Technical and economic analysis

Sentencas: For the PMR-SOFC, it is found that the operation at a higher permeation pressure offers higher power density because lower fuel utilization is required when operating the SOFC at the energy self-sustained condition.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and palladium membrane reactor: Technical and economic analysis

Sentencas: When the membrane reactor is operated at the permeation pressure of 1 bar, the methane-fuelled and biogas-fuelled PMR-SOFCs can achieve the maximum power density of 0.4398 and 0.4213 W/cm(2), respectively.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and palladium membrane reactor: Technical and economic analysis

Sentencas: Although the PMR-SOFC can offer higher power density, compared with the CON-SOFC, the capital costs of supporting units, i.e., palladium membrane reactor, high-pressure compressor, and vacuum pump, for PMR-SOFC need to be taken into account.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and palladium membrane reactor: Technical and economic analysis

Sentencas: The economic analysis shows that the PMR-SOFC is not a good choice from an economic viewpoint because of the requirement of a large high-pressure compressor for feeding gas to the membrane reactor.
Titulo: Integration of solid oxide fuel cell and palladium membrane reactor: Technical and economic analysis
